attributes.name: type
attributes.desc: type of the column. If set to selection, the column will display checkbox. If set to index, the column will display index of the row (staring from 1). If set to expand, the column will display expand icon

attributes.name: index
attributes.desc: customize indices for each row, works on columns with type=index

attributes.name: label
attributes.desc: column label

attributes.name: column-key
attributes.desc: column's key. If you need to use the filter-change event, you need this attribute to identify which column is being filtered

attributes.name: prop
attributes.desc: field name. You can also use its alias: property

attributes.name: width
attributes.desc: column width

attributes.name: min-width
attributes.desc: column minimum width. Columns with width has a fixed width, while columns with min-width has a width that is distributed in proportion

attributes.name: fixed
attributes.desc: whether column is fixed at left / right. Will be fixed at left if true

attributes.name: render-header
attributes.desc: render function for table header of this column

attributes.name: sortable
attributes.desc: whether column can be sorted. Remote sorting can be done by setting this attribute to 'custom' and listening to the sort-change event of Table

attributes.name: sort-method
attributes.desc: sorting method, works when sortable is true. Should return a number, just like Array.sort

attributes.name: sort-by
attributes.desc: specify which property to sort by, works when sortable is true and sort-method is undefined. If set to an Array, the column will sequentially sort by the next property if the previous one is equal

attributes.name: sort-orders
attributes.desc: the order of the sorting strategies used when sorting the data, works when sortable is true. Accepts an array, as the user clicks on the header, the column is sorted in order of the elements in the array

attributes.name: resizable
attributes.desc: whether column width can be resized, works when border of el-table is true

attributes.name: formatter
attributes.desc: function that formats cell content
attributes.optionValue: (row: any, column: TableColumnCtx<T>, cellValue: any, index: number) => VNode | string

attributes.name: show-overflow-tooltip
attributes.desc: whether to hide extra content and show them in a tooltip when hovering on the cell

attributes.name: align
attributes.desc: alignment

attributes.name: header-align
attributes.desc: alignment of the table header. If omitted, the value of the above align attribute will be applied

attributes.name: class-name
attributes.desc: class name of cells in the column

attributes.name: label-class-name
attributes.desc: class name of the label of this column

attributes.name: selectable
attributes.desc: function that determines if a certain row can be selected, works when type is 'selection'

attributes.name: reserve-selection
attributes.desc: whether to reserve selection after data refreshing, works when type is 'selection'. Note that row-key is required for this to work

attributes.name: filters
attributes.desc: an array of data filtering options. For each element in this array, text and value are required

attributes.name: filter-placement
attributes.desc: placement for the filter dropdown
attributes.optionValue: top | top-start | top-end | bottom | bottom-start | bottom-end | left | left-start | left-end | right | right-start | right-end

attributes.name: filter-class-name
attributes.desc: className for the filter dropdown(2.5.0)

attributes.name: filter-multiple
attributes.desc: whether data filtering supports multiple options

attributes.name: filter-method
attributes.desc: data filtering method. If filter-multiple is on, this method will be called multiple times for each row, and a row will display if one of the calls returns true
attributes.optionValue: (value: any, row: any, column: TableColumnCtx<T>) => void

attributes.name: filtered-value
attributes.desc: filter value for selected data, might be useful when table header is rendered with render-header

attributes.name: tooltip-formatter
attributes.desc: customize tooltip content when using show-overflow-tooltip(2.9.4)
attributes.optionValue: (data: { row: any, column: TableColumnCtx<T>, cellValue: any }) => VNode | string
